revised_title: Lattice Spacings in Binary Solid Solutions of Silver and Copper Alloys
tldr: This article investigates the mean lattice spacings of primary solid solutions in silver and copper alloys. The authors used X-ray crystal analysis to determine the lattice constants and compare the mean lattice distortions at equiatomic compositions. The results show that the mean lattice spacing-composition curve is not linear, and the mean lattice distortion in concentrated solid solutions is greater than required by a linear relation.
